algorithm_technique: Combinatorics for counting arrangements and sum of distances
problem_summary_simple: Calculate the total Manhattan distance between all pairs of k pieces on an m x n grid across all possible arrangements.
problem_summary_technical: Uses combinatorics to calculate the sum of distances by considering contributions of horizontal and vertical distances independently, leveraging precomputed factorials and modular inverses.
time_complexity: O(max(m*n)) for precomputation, O(1) for runtime
key_insights: The problem can be decomposed into calculating sums of horizontal and vertical distances separately.
The sum of distances for a single dimension can be expressed using sums of consecutive integers and squares.
Combinations (nCr) are used to count the number of ways to place the remaining pieces.
